bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Using st.file_uploader, I face the following error message at the very beginning of uploading a csv file. and then suddenly the app is refreshed automatically and successfully operated. any idea why the message is shown at the early stage ?? Error message: TypeError: 0.0 has type float, but expected one of: int, long Traceback: File "/home1/irteamsu/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/streamlit/ScriptRunner.py", line 314, in _run_script exec(code, module.dict) File "/home1/irteamsu/Untitled8.py", line 54, in uploaded_file = st.file_uploader("Choose a CSV/Excel file", type="csv") File "/home1/irteamsu/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/streamlit/DeltaGenerator.py", line 140, in wrapped_method

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/angrykim>@angrykim</denchmark-link> - I noticed you are using Python 2.7 from your stack trace. In that case, you are using a pretty old version of Streamlit. I would recommend upgrading your environment to use Python 3.6+ and try again. It's likely the case that if this was a bug, it was fixed by now, or it could be caused by Python 2.7 itself. Best, Randy

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/randyzwitch>@randyzwitch</denchmark-link>
Thank you so much! I will try it :)

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/angrykim>@angrykim</denchmark-link> -- I am going to close this issue for now just to stay on top of cleanup, but if you're still experiencing your problem after upgrading your setup, comment here and we'll reopen. Thanks!
